channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: A360Media傘下のソープオペラダイジェストが週刊誌の発行を終了する。この昼ドラ雑誌は1975年に創刊され、1991年には150万部のピークを記録した（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
A360Media-owned Soap Opera Digest is ending its weekly print run; the daytime drama magazine first launched in 1975 with its circulation peaking at 1.5M in 1991  —  Staffers were informed of the decision Friday, according to sources.  A spokesperson for a360Media, the company that owns the brand …

item.title: SAG-AFTRAとスタジオは週末も話し合いを続ける予定。数千人の組合員が、悪い取引に応じるくらいならストライキを続けるという書簡に署名した（Gene Maddaus/Variety）
item.description:
Gene Maddaus / Variety:
SAG-AFTRA and studios plan to keep talking over the weekend; thousands of union members signed a letter saying they'd keep striking rather than take a bad deal  —  The sessions may be held virtually, rather than in person.  —  The two sides met on Friday for the third day this week at SAG-AFTRA headquarters.

item.title: ディズニーは11月にDisney+の広告オプションを拡大する予定で、入札可能なインベントリ、ファーストパーティのオーディエンスグラフからのデータ、ジオターゲティングなどが含まれる（Alyssa Boyle/AdExchanger）
item.description:
Alyssa Boyle / AdExchanger:
Disney plans to expand its advertising options on Disney+ in November, including biddable inventory, data from its first-party audience graph, and geotargeting  —  Disney is celebrating the first birthday of ad-supported Disney+ with a new slate of targeting and measurement options for advertisers.

item.title: ダン・アッカーマンは、2023年6月に彼を雇ったG/O Mediaのギズモードの編集長を退任し、2023年後半から「新しいコンシューマー・テック」EICの役割を始める（Dan Ackerman/Dan Ackerman on LinkedIn）
item.description:
Dan Ackerman / Dan Ackerman on LinkedIn:
Dan Ackerman is stepping down as editor-in-chief of G/O Media's Gizmodo, which hired him in June 2023, and starting a “new consumer tech” EIC role later in 2023  —  Some big career news: I'm stepping down as Editor-in-Chief of Gizmodo and starting an exciting new consumer tech Editor-in-Chief role later this year.

item.title: Xは、For YouやFollowingに広告が入らず、「最大の返信ブースト」が可能な月額16ドルのPremium+プランと、「小さなブースト」はあるがチェックなしの月額3ドルのBasicプランを追加（Emma Roth/The Verge）
item.description:
Emma Roth / The Verge:
X adds a $16/month Premium+ plan with no ads in For You or Following and the “largest reply boost”, and a $3/month Basic plan with a “small boost” but no check  —  X, the platform previously known as Twitter, has introduced a new $16 per month Premium Plus plan …

item.title: 情報筋BuzzFeedはComplex Networksをeコマース企業Ntwrkに1億4,000万ドル以下で売却する方向で交渉を進めている。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Sources: BuzzFeed is in advanced talks to sell Complex Networks to e-commerce company Ntwrk for less than $140M; BuzzFeed paid ~$300M to acquire Complex in 2021  —  BuzzFeed is negotiating a sale of much of Complex Networks for under $140 million, less than half of what it paid to acquire it two years ago.

item.title: シカゴを拠点とするニュースNPO「Investigative Project on Race and Equity（人種と公正に関する調査プロジェクト）」は、ベテラン記者とパートナーを組むパートタイムの「見習い」に報酬を支払っている（Sophie Culpepper/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Sophie Culpepper / Nieman Lab:
A look at the Chicago-based news nonprofit Investigative Project on Race and Equity, which pays part-time “apprentices” that partner with seasoned reporters  —  “We're growing and learning, but the core of what we do is this really supported experiential learning.”

item.title: 出典：イーロン・マスクとリンダ・ヤッカリーノは、オールハンズの中で、CisionのPR Newswireに匹敵するプレスリリースサービスXWireを創設する野望について言及した（Edward Ludlow/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Edward Ludlow / Bloomberg:
Source: during an all-hands, Elon Musk and Linda Yaccarino referenced ambitions to create XWire, a press release service that would rival Cision's PR Newswire  —  Executives at X, the social media site formerly known as Twitter, said they see YouTube and LinkedIn as future competitors …

item.title: Artforum』誌がイスラエルとハマスの戦争に関する公開書簡を「雑誌の声明として広く誤解された」ことを受け、デヴィッド・ヴェラスコEICを解雇（Zachary Small/New York Times）。
item.description:
Zachary Small / New York Times:
Artforum fires EIC David Velasco after the prestigious outlet's open letter on the Israel-Hamas war “was widely misinterpreted as a statement from the magazine”  —  David Velasco was removed after the magazine's publishers said there was a flawed editorial process behind …

item.title: ボリス・ジョンソン元英国首相は2024年、英総選挙と米選挙を控え、GBニュースに司会者、番組制作者、コメンテーターとして加わる予定（GBニュース）
item.description:
GB News:
Former UK PM Boris Johnson plans to join GB News as a presenter, program maker, and commentator in 2024, ahead of the UK general election and the US elections  —  Former Prime Minister Boris Johnson will play a key role on Britain's news channel  —  Former Prime Minister Boris Johnson …

item.title: Charterは2023年第3四半期に32万人のビデオ顧客を失ったが、これは9月のDisneyのキャリッジ紛争が原因。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
Charter lost 320K video customers in Q3 2023, citing the Disney carriage dispute in September, compared to 211K video customers the cable giant lost in Q3 2022  —  Disney's channels, including ESPN, ABC and FX, went dark for Charter customers in September.  —  Charter Communications …

item.title: ハサン・ミンハジが、ニューヨーカー誌の自分に関するプロフィールを「不必要に誤解を招く」とするビデオを撮影。同誌は「慎重に報道した」と擁護している（Rick Porter/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Rick Porter / Hollywood Reporter:
Hasan Minhaj records a video in which he calls The New Yorker's profile of him “so needlessly misleading”; the magazine defends its work as “carefully reported”  —  The comedian releases a 20-minute video to THR giving his perspective on the profile, which accused him of fabricating details in his stand-up.

item.title: スポーツジャーナリストはXに固執している。このサイトはニュースを共有し、読者と交流するための有用なツールであり続けており、フォロワーを手放したくないからだ（Jesus Jiménez/New York Times）
item.description:
Jesus Jiménez / New York Times:
Sports journalists stick to X as the site remains a useful tool for sharing news and interacting with readers, and they are reluctant to give up their followers  —  Many users have migrated to other platforms since Elon Musk bought Twitter, but sports fans still find it indispensable.

item.title: ライカ、9,480ドルのカメラ「M11-P」を発売。このカメラには、誤った情報と戦うために支援団体が作成したメタデータシステム「Content Credentials」で写真に透かしが入る（Andrew Tarantola/Engadget）
item.description:
Andrew Tarantola / Engadget:
Leica releases the $9,480 M11-P camera, which watermarks photos with the Content Credentials metadata system, created by advocacy groups to fight misinformation  —  It automatically watermarks photos with Content Credentials metadata.  —  It's getting to the point these days that we can't even trust …

item.title: アマゾンのアンディ・ジャッシーCEOは、ビデオ、コマース、食料品に広告を統合する方法を考え出すにあたって、同社は「やっと表面を削ったところだ」と語っている（Dade Hayes/Deadline）
item.description:
Dade Hayes / Deadline:
Amazon CEO Andy Jassy says the company has “barely scraped the surface” in figuring out how to integrate ads into its video, commerce, and grocery offerings  —  - Comcast Faces Skepticism On Wall Street As Ad Decline Accelerates, Strike Toll Mounts And Broadband Experiences Buffering
